scl10.uk.ac.aber.users.manipulators

Class ImageManipulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • scl10.uk.ac.aber.users.manipulators.ImageManipulator

  • public final class ImageManipulator
extends java.lang.Object
    A class used applying pixel manipulation functions to bufferedImages.
    Author:
    Scott Lockett

    • Method Detail

      • applyWarpFunctionToImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage applyWarpFunctionToImage(@NonNull
                                                                    java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                                    @NonNull
                                                                    double[][] xwarp,
                                                                    @NonNull
                                                                    double[][] ywarp)
        Applies a given x and y pixel shift to an image. Also converts image to grey scale in the process.
        Parameters:
        image - 2D representation of an image which he pixels values for each pixel within the image. cannot be null.
        xwarp - 2D x warp which is going to be applied to the image. Can not be null.
        ywarp - 2D y warp which is going to be applied to the image. Can not be null.
        Returns:
        A registered image with both of the functions applied to the input image

      • convertColorImageToGreyscale

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage convertColorImageToGreyscale(@NonNull
                                                                        java.awt.image.BufferedImage imageToConvert)
        Converts a colour image to a greyscale image. Should the image already be greyscale then it is simply returned. Code was modified from here.
        Parameters:
        imageToConvert - The colour image that is to become a greysacle image. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        A greyscale equivalent of the input colour image.

      • convertImageToMatrix

        private static org.opencv.core.Mat convertImageToMatrix(@NonNull
                                                        java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
        Converts a BufferedImage into an open CV matrix object. Modified from here.
        Parameters:
        img - The image to be converted into an open CV matrix. Can not be null.
        Returns:
        The matrix equivalent of the input buffered image.

      • convertMatrixToImage

        private static java.awt.image.BufferedImage convertMatrixToImage(@NonNull
                                                                 org.opencv.core.Mat matrix)
        Converts a matrix object into a Buffered Image. Modified from here.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix to be converted into a buffered image. Can not be null.
        Returns:
        The buffered image equivalent of the input matrix

      • createAveragedColouredImageFromImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage createAveragedColouredImageFromImage(@NonNull
                                                                                java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
        Determines the average colour of an image and creates a new buffered image the same size as the input image that is wholly the colour of the average pixel colour.
        Parameters:
        img - The image thats average pixel colour is required. Can not be null.
        Returns:
        An image the same size as the input image that is entirely the average colour of the input image.

      • downsample

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage downsample(@NonNull
                                                      java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
        Downsamples a given image by half in both the width and height
        Parameters:
        img - The image that is to be downsampled. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        A downsampled version of the image.

      • flipImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage flipImage(@NonNull
                                                     java.awt.image.BufferedImage imageToFlip,
                                                     int flipDirection)
        Flips a given image across a given axis.
        Parameters:
        imageToFlip - The image to be flipped. cannot be null.
        flipDirection - The axis of the image that is going to be flipped on, either -1, 0 or 1.
        Returns:
        The flipped version of the image across the given axis.

      • upsample

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage upsample(@NonNull
                                                    java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                    @NonNull
                                                    org.opencv.core.Size newSize)
        Upsamples a given image by doubling the image in both the width and height.
        Parameters:
        img - The image that is to be upsampled. cannot be null.
        newSize - The desired size of the image. cannot be null.

        The new size MUST be the image's (width * 2) +/- 1 and the image's (height * 2) +/- 1.

        Returns:
        An upsampled version of the given image.

      • writeImageFile

        public static boolean writeImageFile(@NonNull
                                     java.io.File fileToWriteTo,
                                     @NonNull
                                     java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Writes a buffered image out to a given file that is saved as a JPG.
        Parameters:
        fileToWriteTo - The file which is going to be written to. cannot be null.
        image - The image that is going to be written out. cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true is the file was successfully written to, or false if an exception was thrown during the writing.
